intro: Cyphostemma pseudonjegerre, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by distinctive, inflated fruits. It is adapted to arid environments and has a shallow root system that allows it to thrive in poor soil conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
